item.title: Custom Interface
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“portugalrox, post:3, topic:550483”]Edit:

Code: public static void Rules(TextDrawingArea[] tda) { RSInterface RSinterface = addInterface(12000); addSprite(12001, 0, "Interfaces/Rules/WELCOME"); addHoverButton(12002, "Interfaces/Rules/WELCOME", 1, 72, 32, "Accept", -1, 12003, 1); addHoveredButton(12003, "Interfaces/Rules/WELCOME", 2, 72, 32, 12004); addText(12005, "ACCEPT", tda, 1, 0x86B404, true, true); int last = 4; RSinterface.children = new int[last]; RSinterface.childX = new int[last]; RSinterface.childY = new int[last]; //SpriteID x y childID setBounds(12001, 50, 50, 0,RSinterface); setBounds(12002, 200, 226, 1,RSinterface); setBounds(12003, 140, 110, 2,RSinterface); setBounds(12005, 200, 225, 1,RSinterface); }

I added the correct path and here is what my interface looks like
http://prntscr.com/6fny0s

But it is coming off as a choose your leg colour interface??[/quote]

The reason it’s showing that interface is because you’re trying to load a sprite or etc that doesn’t exist, so it’s showing what could be considered a “default” interface.

I’d assume it has something to do with:

//SpriteID x y childID setBounds(12001, 50, 50, 0,RSinterface); setBounds(12002, 200, 226, 1,RSinterface); setBounds(12003, 140, 110, 2,RSinterface); setBounds(12005, 200, 225, 1,RSinterface);

Because the fourth number is the ‘frame’ or child in the interface. If you look closely, you use ‘1’ twice. Might want to change the second one to 3.

The sprites you showed in the picture… They must be in YourCacheName/Sprites/Interfaces/Rules/
And ALL of them must be named “WELCOME” with a space, and then the number after it.
“SPRITE 1” needs to be “WELCOME 1” and “SPRITE 2” needs to be “WELCOME 2”

Read full topic

item.title: Custom Interface
item.dc:creator: @portugalrox portugalrox
item.description:
@portugalrox wrote:

Edit:

Code: public static void Rules(TextDrawingArea[] tda) { RSInterface RSinterface = addInterface(12000); addSprite(12001, 0, "Interfaces/Rules/WELCOME"); addHoverButton(12002, "Interfaces/Rules/WELCOME", 1, 72, 32, "Accept", -1, 12003, 1); addHoveredButton(12003, "Interfaces/Rules/WELCOME", 2, 72, 32, 12004); addText(12005, "ACCEPT", tda, 1, 0x86B404, true, true); int last = 4; RSinterface.children = new int[last]; RSinterface.childX = new int[last]; RSinterface.childY = new int[last]; //SpriteID x y childID setBounds(12001, 50, 50, 0,RSinterface); setBounds(12002, 200, 226, 1,RSinterface); setBounds(12003, 140, 110, 2,RSinterface); setBounds(12005, 200, 225, 1,RSinterface); }

I added the correct path and here is what my interface looks like
http://prntscr.com/6fny0s

But it is coming off as a choose your leg colour interface??

Read full topic

item.title: Custom Interface
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Yeah. You added about a dozen braces where you needed parenthesis.

addSprite{32001, 0, "Interfaces/Rules/WELCOME"}; addHoverButton{32002, "Interfaces/Rules/WELCOME", 6, 72, 32, "Accept", -1, 32003, 1}; addHoveredButton{32003, "Interfaces/Rules/WELCOME", 7, 72, 32, 32004}; addText{32005, "ACCEPT", TDA, 3, 2109881.4, true, false}; setChildren{13, tab}; //SpriteID x y childID setBounds{32001, 50, 50, 0}; setBounds{32002, 200, 226, 6}; setBounds{32003, 140, 110, 7}; setBounds{32005, 200, 225, 6};

All of the “{” need to be changed to “(” and all the “}” need to be “)”.

Read full topic

item.title: Custom Interface
item.dc:creator: @portugalrox portugalrox
item.description:
@portugalrox wrote:

Can someone explain what I did wrong lol…

public static void Rules(TextDrawingArea[] tda) { RSInterface tab = addScreenInterface(32000); addSprite{32001, 0, "Interfaces/Rules/WELCOME"}; addHoverButton{32002, "Interfaces/Rules/WELCOME", 6, 72, 32, "Accept", -1, 32003, 1}; addHoveredButton{32003, "Interfaces/Rules/WELCOME", 7, 72, 32, 32004}; addText{32005, "ACCEPT", TDA, 3, 2109881.4, true, false}; setChildren{13, Interface}; //SpriteID x y childID setBounds{32001, 50, 50, 0}; setBounds{32002, 200, 226, 6}; setBounds{32003, 140, 110, 7}; setBounds{32005, 200, 225, 6}; }

Java\RSInterface.java:392: error: not a statement addSprite{32001, 0, "Interfaces/Rules/WELCOME"}; ^ Java\RSInterface.java:392: error: ';' expected addSprite{32001, 0, "Interfaces/Rules/WELCOME"}; ^ Java\RSInterface.java:392: error: not a statement addSprite{32001, 0, "Interfaces/Rules/WELCOME"}; ^ Java\RSInterface.java:392: error: ';' expected addSprite{32001, 0, "Interfaces/Rules/WELCOME"}; ^ Java\RSInterface.java:393: error: not a statement addHoverButton{32002, "Interfaces/Rules/WELCOME", 6, 72, 32, "Accept", -1, 32003, 1}; ^ Java\RSInterface.java:394: error: ';' expected addHoveredButton{32003, "Interfaces/Rules/WELCOME", 7, 72, 32, 32004}; ^ Java\RSInterface.java:394: error: not a statement addHoveredButton{32003, "Interfaces/Rules/WELCOME", 7, 72, 32, 32004}; ^ Java\RSInterface.java:395: error: ';' expected addText{32005, "ACCEPT", TDA, 3, 2109881.4, true, false}; ^ Java\RSInterface.java:395: error: not a statement addText{32005, "ACCEPT", TDA, 3, 2109881.4, true, false};
